content.text: 1 1/4 cups all-purpose flour
content.eamr: ( ing-0 "1 1/4 cups all-purpose flour" )

content.text: 1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder
content.eamr: ( ing-1 "1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder" )

content.text: 1/2 teaspoon salt
content.eamr: ( ing-2 "1/2 teaspoon salt" )

content.text: 1/4 cup sliced almonds
content.eamr: ( ing-3 "1/4 cup sliced almonds" )

content.text: 1/4 cup butter, softened
content.eamr: ( ing-4 "1/4 cup butter, softened" )

content.text: 2/3 cup white sugar
content.eamr: ( ing-5 "2/3 cup white sugar" )

content.text: 1 egg, beaten
content.eamr: ( ing-6 "1 egg, beaten" )

content.text: 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
content.eamr: ( ing-7 "1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract" )

content.text: 0) Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
1) Turn a 9x5 inch loaf pan or metal bowl upside down and cover the outside with foil.
2) Place onto a cookie sheet.
3) Stir together the flour, cocoa, salt and almonds; set aside.
content.eamr:
( inst-3 / R
	:inform ( ac-3-0 "Stir"@3:7 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-0 "flour"@21:26 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-1 "cocoa"@28:33 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-2 "salt"@35:39 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-3 "almonds"@44:51 / FOOD )
	)
	:inform ( ac-3-1 "set aside"@53:62 / AC
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
	)
)

content.text: 4) In a medium bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until smooth.
content.eamr:
( inst-4 / R
	:inform ( ac-4-0 "cream"@21:26 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-4 "the butter"@36:46 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-5 "sugar"@51:56 / FOOD )
		:loc ( tool-4-0 "a medium bowl"@6:19 / TOOL )
		:until ( cond-4-0 "until smooth"@57:69 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
	)
)

content.text: 5) Beat in the egg and vanilla.
content.eamr:
( inst-5 / R
	:inform ( ac-5-0 "Beat in"@3:10 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-6 "the egg"@11:18 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-7 "vanilla"@23:30 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
	)
)

content.text: 6) Gradually stir in the dry ingredients to form a fairly stiff dough.
content.eamr:
( inst-6 / R
	:inform ( ac-6-0 "stir in"@13:20 / AC
		:ppt ( "the dry ingredients"@21:40 / FOOD )
		:prp ( purp-6-0 "to form a fairly stiff dough"@41:69 / PURPOSE_CLAUSE )
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
	)
)

content.text: 7) On a lightly floured surface, roll the dough out to 1/4 inch in thickness.
content.eamr:
( inst-7 / R
	:inform ( ac-7-0 "roll"@33:37 / AC
		:loc ( tool-7-0 "a lightly floured surface"@6:31 / TOOL )
		:ppt ( "the dough"@38:47 / FOOD )
		:reshape ( "1/4 inch in thickness"@55:76 / OTHER )
	)
)

content.text: 8) Cut into circles using a glass or cookie cutter.
content.eamr:
( inst-8 / R
	:inform ( ac-8-0 "Cut"@3:6 / AC
		:reshape ( "circles"@12:19 / OTHER )
		:instrument ( tool-8-0 "a glass"@26:33 / TOOL )
		:instrument ( tool-8-1 "cookie cutter"@37:50 / TOOL )
	)
)

content.text: 9) Starting at the top (bottom) of the pan or bowl, arrange cookies so they are overlapping.
content.eamr:
( inst-9 / R
	:inform ( ac-9-0 "arrange"@53:60 / AC
		:ppt ( "cookies"@61:68 / FOOD )
		:prp ( purp-9-0 "so they are overlapping"@69:92 / PURPOSE_CLAUSE )
	)
	:inform ( tool-9-0 "the pan"@36:43 / TOOL )
	:inform ( tool-9-1 "bowl"@47:51 / TOOL )
)

content.text: 10) Work toward the edges covering as much of the pan as you can.
11) Be sure to press each cookie on so you will have a good solid bowl.
12) Bake for 10 to 15 minutes in the preheated oven, until cookies are firm.
content.eamr:
( inst-12 / R
	:inform ( ac-12-0 "Bake"@4:8 / AC
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
		:duration ( dur-12-0 "10 to 15 minutes"@13:29 / DUR )
		:loc ( tool-12-0 "the preheated oven"@33:51 / TOOL )
		:until ( cond-12-0 "until cookies are firm"@53:75 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
	)
)

content.text: 13) Cool completely.
14) Carefully turn the pan over and remove the pan from the foil, then carefully remove the foil from inside the cookie structure.
15) Fill with cookie or candy.
content.eamr:
( inst-15 / R
	:inform ( ac-15-0 "Fill"@4:8 / AC
		:ppt ( "cookie"@14:20 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( "candy"@24:29 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
	)
)
